entry.title: re:Invent 2023 Sneak Peak - AWS Networking
entry.content:
9 November 2023

re:Invent 2023 Sneak Peak - AWS Networking

Hosts:
Riggs Goodman III & Tom Adamski

Guests:

Abstract:
In this session, we will cover the Networking focused sessions that we will have at re:Invent this year. These include breakout sessions, chalk talks, workshops,and builder sessions. If you are not going to re:Invent, we will also cover how to attend virtually or how to watch the sessions after the event.

Session hasn't started. Join live on 9 November 2023 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

entry.title: Designing AWS networks for growth and scale

link.title: Designing AWS networks for growth and scale

entry.content:
2 November 2023

Designing AWS networks for growth and scale

Hosts:
Sidhartha Chauhan & Tom Adamski

Guests:

Abstract:
As companies grow, their AWS network architectures need to evolve to accommodate increasing traffic, security needs, and complexity. This session will provide strategies and best practices for designing scalable, secure, and highly available AWS networks. We will discuss how to design VPCs, subnets, route tables, security groups, and other components to allow for future growth. Topics will include choosing the right VPC topology, connecting VPCs and hybrid networks with AWS Transit Gateway, AWS Cloud WAN, building hub-and-spoke models, and integrating network security tools. Attendees will learn how to assess current workloads and plan network changes to support growth over time. The session will cover options for scaling up network capacity, segmenting resources, and automating network management tasks. Architects, network administrators, and cloud practitioners looking to design future-ready AWS networks that can evolve smoothly will find practical takeaways.

entry.title: Protecting against login fraud using WAF/ATP/JA3 fingerprints

link.title: Protecting against login fraud using WAF/ATP/JA3 fingerprints

entry.content:
26 October 2023

Protecting against login fraud using WAF/ATP/JA3 fingerprints

Hosts:
Tom Adamski

Guests:
Oleksandr Golovatyi, Senior Technical Account Manager
Jess Izen, Senior Software Development Engineer

Abstract:
Join us to deep dive into signals on multiple IP reuse by bots, password brute force attacks and username traversal attempts. We will also discuss suspicious TLS fingerprints signal and composite rate limiting using JA3 fingerprints and JWT tokens.

entry.title: Insights into Internet woes and application performance using CloudWatch Internet Monitor

link.title: Insights into Internet woes and application performance using CloudWatch Internet Monitor

entry.content:
19 October 2023

Insights into Internet woes and application performance using CloudWatch Internet Monitor

Hosts:
Alexandra Huides

Guests:
Subbu Mahadevan, Senior Manager, Technical Product Management, Network Availability
Chandan Rao, Software Development Manager, IP Insights

Abstract:
Organizations looking to provide superior digital experiences to their users need to monitor these digital experiences proactively. In this session, you will learn more about Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor capabilities and roadmap that help you continuously monitor internet performance metrics, such as availability and performance between your AWS-hosted applications and application end users. Explore how you can visualize impact, pinpoint the geographic locations and providers that are impacted, and take actions as an application developer or network engineer to improve your end users’ network experience.

entry.title: Cutting cost, not corners. You don’t have to be Netflix to do IPv6

link.title: Cutting cost, not corners. You don’t have to be Netflix to do IPv6

entry.content:
12 October 2023

Cutting cost, not corners. You don't have to be Netflix to do IPv6

Hosts:
Alexandra Huides, Tom Adamski

Guests:
Donavan Fritz, Staff Network Platform Engineer
Joel Kodama, Senior Network Site Reliability Engineer

Abstract:
Join us for a session with Netflix. We'll cover how Netflix approached their migration to IPv6 and the lessons they've learned along the way. Expect practical insights into the real-world implications of adopting IPv6 at scale, including the challenges faced and the innovative solutions employed to ensure a seamless transition.

entry.title: AWS Global Accelerator launches (including ELB features).

link.title: AWS Global Accelerator launches (including ELB features).

entry.content:
5 October 2023

AWS Global Accelerator launches (including ELB features).

Hosts:
Jamie Wenzel

Guests:
Sandeep Panda, Senior Product Manager

Abstract:
Join us to learn about the new AWS Global Accelerator launch for supporting Source IP Preservation with AWS Network Load Balancer targets.

entry.title: Security for Networking
entry.content:
21 September 2023

Security for Networking

Hosts:
Riggs Goodman III, Jamie Wenzel

Guests:

Abstract:
In this twitch session, we will focus on many security mechanisms within AWS VPC Networking, including VPC Lattice and other constructs. If you have questions, please bring them to the show

entry.title: AWS Network Manger: Centralize management and monitoring of networking resource

link.title: AWS Network Manger: Centralize management and monitoring of networking resource

entry.content:
14 September 2023

AWS Network Manger: Centralize management and monitoring of networking resource

Hosts:
Sidhartha Chauhan

Guests:
Ankush Goyal, Senior Technical Account Manager
Nishant Kumar, Senior Product Manager

Abstract:
In this session we will provide an overview of AWS Network Manager and discuss in detail how customers can leverage Network Manager for monitoring their Transit Gateways (TGWs). We will walk through a demo of how to register and visualize your TGWs in Network Manager as well as configure (TGW) events via Network Manager for monitoring/troubleshooting purposes. We will also cover how Route Analyzer can be utilized to perform an analysis of the routes in your transit gateway route tables.

entry.title: Fireside chat with John Zobrist on the Application networking Customer Success team

link.title: Fireside chat with John Zobrist on the Application networking Customer Success team

entry.content:
7 September 2023

Fireside chat with John Zobrist on the Application networking Customer Success team

Hosts:
Jamie Wenzel

Guests:
Jon Zobrist, Head of ELB Customer Success

Abstract:
Today we will talk about Application networking scaling techniques. How to scale, when to scale and how to shard. We will answer questions as we can on how AWS handles scaling unde the hood so your workloads are never starved for resources.

entry.title: Introduction to Amazon Route 53 Domains Service

link.title: Introduction to Amazon Route 53 Domains Service

entry.content:
31 August 2023

Introduction to Amazon Route 53 Domains Service

Hosts:
Riggs Goodman III

Guests:
Rasam Hafezi, Software Development Manager, Amazon Registrar
Gregory DiBiase, Sr. Corp Counsel, IP Ops

Abstract:
In this session, we will provide an overview of the Amazon Route 53 Domains business which enables customers to register and manage their domains on AWS. We'll also provide background on domain operations and the unique benefits of using Route 53's domain registration service.
